validmind.vm_models

Models entrypoint

validmind.vm_models.test_result

TestResult models

validmind.vm_models.test_plan

TestPlan class

TestPlan Objects

@dataclass
class TestPlan()

Base class for test plans. Test plans are used to define any arbitrary grouping of tests that will be run on a dataset or model.

validate_context

def validate_context()

Validates that the context elements are present in the instance so that the test plan can be run

run

def run(send=True)

Runs the test plan

validmind.vm_models.figure

Figure objects track the figure schema supported by the ValidMind API

Figure Objects

@dataclass
class Figure()

Figure objects track the schema supported by the ValidMind API

serialize

def serialize()

Serializes the Figure to a dictionary so it can be sent to the API

validmind.vm_models.dataset_utils

Utilities for manipulating VMDataset objects

get_x_and_y

def get_x_and_y(df, target_column)

Get the X and Y dataframes from the input dataset.

parse_dataset_variables

def parse_dataset_variables(df, options=None)

Infers the data types for each column using pandas_profiling’s typeset from visions library.

If dummy variables were specified with dataset_options, we will not inter the types for these columns since they need to be described as a group of columns (e.g. dummy_a, dummy_b, dummy_c, etc.)

When a type is inferred as Unsupported we check if it’s a null column and mark it appropriately.

describe_dataset_field

def describe_dataset_field(df, field)

Gets descriptive statistics for a single field in a Pandas DataFrame.

get_field_histograms

def get_field_histograms(df, field, type_)

Returns a collection of histograms for a numerical or categorical field. We store different combinations of bin sizes to allow analyzing the data better

Will be used in favor of _get_histogram in the future

get_numerical_histograms

def get_numerical_histograms(df, field)

Returns a collection of histograms for a numerical field, each one with a different bin size

validmind.vm_models.model

Model class wrapper

ModelAttributes Objects

@dataclass()
class ModelAttributes()

Model attributes definition

Model Objects

@dataclass
class Model()

Model class wrapper

serialize

def serialize()

Serializes the model to a dictionary so it can be sent to the API

predict

def predict(*args, **kwargs)

Predict method for the model. This is a wrapper around the model’s predict_proba (for classification) or predict (for regression) method

NOTE: This only works for sklearn or xgboost models at the moment

is_supported_model

@classmethod
def is_supported_model(cls, model)

Checks if the model is supported by the API

validmind.vm_models.dataset

Dataset class wrapper

DatasetTargets Objects

@dataclass()
class DatasetTargets()

Dataset targets definition

Dataset Objects

@dataclass()
class Dataset()

Model class wrapper

__post_init__

def __post_init__()

Set target_column and class_labels from DatasetTargets

x

@property
def x()

Returns the dataset’s features

y

@property
def y()

Returns the dataset’s target column

get_feature_by_id

def get_feature_by_id(feature_id)

Returns the feature with the given id. We also build a lazy lookup cache in case the same feature is requested multiple times.

get_feature_type

def get_feature_type(feature_id)

Returns the type of the feature with the given id

serialize

def serialize()

Serializes the model to a dictionary so it can be sent to the API

describe

def describe()

Extracts descriptive statistics for each field in the dataset

get_correlations

def get_correlations()

Extracts correlations for each field in the dataset

get_correlation_plots

def get_correlation_plots(n_top=15)

Extracts correlation plots for the n_top correlations in the dataset

transformed_dataset

@property
def transformed_dataset(force_refresh=False)

Returns a transformed dataset that uses the features from vm_dataset. Some of the features in vm_dataset are of type Dummy so we need to reverse the one hot encoding and drop the individual dummy columns

validmind.vm_models.metric

Class for storing ValidMind metric objects and associated data for display and reporting purposes

Metric Objects

@dataclass
class Metric(TestContextUtils)

Metric objects track the schema supported by the ValidMind API

__post_init__

def __post_init__()

Set default params if not provided

run

def run(*args, **kwargs)

Run the metric calculation and cache its results

cache_results

def cache_results(metric_value: Union[dict, list, pd.DataFrame],
                  figures: Optional[object] = None)

Cache the results of the metric calculation and do any post-processing if needed

validmind.vm_models.plot_utils

Plot utilities

get_box_plot

def get_box_plot(df, x, y)

Returns a box plot for a pair of features

get_crosstab_plot

def get_crosstab_plot(vm_dataset, x, y)

Returns a crosstab plot for a pair of features. If one of the features is the target column, we should not use it as an index

get_scatter_plot

def get_scatter_plot(df, x, y)

Returns a scatter plot for a pair of features

get_plot_for_feature_pair

def get_plot_for_feature_pair(vm_dataset, x, y)

Checks the data types for each feature pair and creates the appropriate plot to represent their relationship

validmind.vm_models.threshold_test

(Threshold)Test class wrapper. Our API exposes the concept of of a Test (as test_results) but we’ll refer to it as a ThresholdTest to avoid confusion with the “tests” in the general data science/modeling sense.

TODO: Test definitions should be supported in the API too

ThresholdTest Objects

@dataclass
class ThresholdTest(TestContextUtils)

A threshold test is a combination of a metric/plot we track and a corresponding set of parameters and thresholds values that allow us to determine whether the metric/plot passes or fails.

__post_init__

def __post_init__()

Set default params if not provided

run

def run(*args, **kwargs)

Run the test and cache its results

cache_results

def cache_results(results: List[TestResult], passed: bool)

Cache the individual results of the threshold test as a list of TestResult objects

validmind.vm_models.test_plan_result

TestPlanResult

TestPlanResult Objects

@dataclass
class TestPlanResult()

Result wrapper tests that run as part of a test plan

validmind.vm_models.test_context

TestContext

TestContext Objects

@dataclass
class TestContext()

Holds context that can be used by tests to run. Allows us to store data that needs to be reused across different tests/metrics such as model predictions, shared dataset metrics, etc.

TestContextUtils Objects

class TestContextUtils()

Utility methods for classes that receive a TestContext

TODO: more validation

class_predictions

def class_predictions(y_predict)

Converts a set of probability predictions to class predictions

df

@property
def df()

Returns a Pandas DataFrame for the dataset, first checking if we passed in a Dataset or a DataFrame

validmind.vm_models.metric_result

MetricResult wrapper

MetricResult Objects

@dataclass
class MetricResult()

MetricResult class definition. A MetricResult is returned by any internal method that extracts metrics from a dataset or model, and returns 1) Metric and Figure objects that can be sent to the API and 2) and plots and metadata for display purposes

serialize

def serialize()

Serializes the Metric to a dictionary so it can be sent to the API
